meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or resembling a papilla.
meanings.sent1: The papillar texture of the leaf made it feel bumpy.
meanings.sent2: Her papillar skin had tiny raised bumps all over.
meanings.sent3: The papillar design on the cake made it look like a mini mountain range.
meanings.sent4: The papillar clouds in the sky resembled fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent5: The papillar sensation of the fabric against his skin was oddly comforting.

meanings.sent1: The cat's tongue was papillar, aiding in grooming its fur.
meanings.sent2: The papillar surface of the tongue helped in tasting different flavors.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her papillar taste buds were like tiny detectives exploring each flavor.
meanings.sent4: The papillar nature of the carpet made it perfect for massaging bare feet.
meanings.sent5: The papillar feeling of the toothbrush bristles was oddly satisfying.
